channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Q & A
channel.desc: World War II veterans - former U.S. Navy gunnery officer Steven Ellis and former U.S. Army Air Force B-24 navigator Rolf Slen - talk about their experiences during the war. Mr.Ellis, age 99, and Mr.Slen, age 100, both served in the Pacific Theater.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Live: End of World War II 80th Anniversary Conference
channel.desc: Historians gather to commemorate the 80th anniversary of the end of World War II in 1945 at the National World War II Museum in New Orleans.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Lectures in History
channel.desc: Classroom lectures on American history.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Live: End of World War II 80th Anniversary Conference
channel.desc: Historians gather to commemorate the 80th anniversary of the end of World War II in 1945 at the National World War II Museum in New Orleans.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: American History TV
channel.desc: Airing weekends, "American History TV" offers programming about people and events that document the American story, geared toward history aficionados. Shows that air under the "American History TV" banner cover the history of the nation, from its founding in the 18th century through modern times. Topics covered include the Civil War, presidents and the exploration of historical sites.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Live: End of World War II 80th Anniversary Conference

channel.desc: Airing weekends, "American History TV" offers programming about people and events that document the American story, geared toward history aficionados. channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: National World War II Museum Rare Artifacts Exhibit
channel.desc: American History TV tours the National World War II Museum's Malcolm S. Forbes Rare and Iconic Artifacts Gallery and new interactive oral history exhibit.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: The Museum of the Ameican Revolution hosts a walking tour of historic sites in Philadelphia.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: A walking tour of Boston's Freedom Trail features stops at the site of the Boston Massacre, Old State House, Faneuil Hall, and Old North Church. The tour is organized by Hub Town Tours of Boston.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This 1945 U.S. Office of War Information United News newsreel shows an overview of Japan at war in the Pacific since 1931 through the celebration of Japan's surrender and the end of World War II in Times Square.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Garrett Graff, The Devil Reached Toward the Sky
channel.desc: Historian Garrett Graff discusses his oral history of the development, testing and deployment of the atomic bomb in August 1945.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Q & A

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Bruce Bechtol, Rogue Allies
channel.desc: Angelo State University professor Bruce Bechtol talks about the relationship between North Korea and Iran and argues that those two nations are working to destabilize the current world order.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Author Andrew Roberts discusses the reign of King George III, the last monarch of the British colonies in America, and argues that he has been misunderstood.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Historian Harlow Giles Unger recounts the efforts of Richard Henry Lee in the Revolutionary War; from his call for independence from Britain in the Second Continental Congress to his exploits on the battlefield.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: National Constitution Center president and CEO Jeffrey Rosen talks with Jeffrey Goldberg, editor in chief of The Atlantic, about how the Founding Fathers thought about virtue and were influenced by classical writers.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Bruce Bechtol, Rogue Allies
channel.desc: Angelo State University professor Bruce Bechtol talks about the relationship between North Korea and Iran and argues that those two nations are working to destabilize the current world order.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: History Bookshelf
channel.desc: Eri Hotta, former research fellow at the National Graduate Institute for Policy Studies in Tokyo, talks about her book, "Japan 1941: Countdown to Infamy," in which she examines the attack on Pearl Harbor from the Japanese perspective.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Jonathan Horn, the Fate of Generals
channel.desc: Jonthan Horn recounts Japan's invasion of the Philippines during World War II, the surrender of American forces in May 1942, Gen. Douglas MacArthur's vow to return to the islands, and the imprisonment of Gen. Jonathan Mayhew Wainright.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: History Bookshelf
channel.desc: A.J. Baime recalls the challenges that President Harry Truman faced during his first four months in office.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: After Words
channel.desc: British historian Max Hastings explores World War II from the personal point of view. Using detailed stories of the lives of everyday people to reveal the individual hardships of civilians who struggled to survive.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: History Bookshelf
channel.desc: Susan Southard talks about the effects of the atomic bomb on Nagasaki on the city and its people from her book, "Nagasaki: Life After Nuclear War.".
